sentences.en: Along with that, it must be added, went a strong pedantic and antiquarian strain.
sentences.cn: 必须指出一股强烈的学究尚古风气也随之产生了.

sentences.en: Great Books are popular, not pedantic. They are not written by specialists about specialties for specialists.
sentences.cn: 名著绝不引经据典,艰深难懂, 而是通俗易读. 它们不是专家为专业人员撰写的专业书籍.

sentences.en: He is learned, but neither stuffy nor pedantic.
sentences.cn: 他很博学, 但既不妄自尊大也不卖弄学问.

sentences.en: His lecture was so pedantic and uninteresting.
sentences.cn: 他的讲座学究气太浓，没意思。

sentences.en: In the discussion he often seemed petty and pedantic.
sentences.cn: 在交谈当中,他往往拘泥小节,咬文嚼字.

sentences.en: It was pedantic rather than reasonable, just to the point of being grotesque.
sentences.cn: 它根本谈不上合理不合理, 甚至迂腐到令人可笑的地步.

sentences.en: Keep it, in any case, familiar, facetious even, rather then pedantic and portentous.
sentences.cn: 无论如何, 要使它显得很随便, 甚至滑稽可笑, 而不要显得很迂腐,夜郎自大.

sentences.en: Old - type intellectuals are inevitably a little poor and pedantic.
sentences.cn: 旧式 文人的身上难免有些穷酸气.

sentences.en: One who instructs in a pedantic or dogmatic manner.
sentences.cn: 学究以陈腐或教条的方式施教的人.

sentences.en: People think it more pedantic than practicable.
sentences.cn: 尤其是在孔子的政治思想上,聚讼最多.

sentences.en: Reading in a pedantic way may turn you into a bookworm or a bookcase, and has long been opposed.
sentences.cn: 读死书会变成书呆子,甚至于成为书橱, 早有人反对过了.

sentences.en: They incline to the academic, the exclusive, the theoretical, and the pedantic.
sentences.cn: 他们具有学术, 排外, 理论和学究的倾向.

sentences.en: They tend to make your style heavy, dry, and pedantic.
sentences.cn: 它们会使你的文体沉重 、 干涩而且迂腐.

sentences.en: Well, let me be a little pedantic ( in the name of science ).
sentences.cn: 这样吧, 让我也来抛一下书包吧 ( 我是以科学的名义来解释的 ).

sentences.en: Writing user input validation is pedantic and error - prone but very necessary.
sentences.cn: 编写用户输入验证是呆板的、易出错的,但是很必要.
